Body:
To decide, whether the language was Celtic, we need to know about:

  1. Intervocalic lenition (which, according to Jasku≈Ça, was one of the most probable characteristic of Celtic languages).

  2. Word order (which is specific for Continental Celtic and differs from e.g. Italic languages).

  3. The state of prepositions (if there were any).

  4. Case endings (if there were any).

  5. Correspondenses between vocal systems of (Proto) Celtic and Lusitanian, which can be given by e.g. theonyms.
